author: dedenbach2011
title: Hail Hydra
review:
Ok, Mighty Micros.  People either think you are fun and cool or people don't like you.  I wasn't too impressed with these sets at first, but they sure grow on you and once you get 1 or 2 of them you might as well get all of them.  There are 3 marvel ones and 3 DC ones.  This is part of the first wave of Mighty Micros and coming soon nearish to 2017 new ones will be out.  Let's break this Captain America and Red Skull one down.

Awesomeness:  Compared to the others this one is pretty good.  Red Skull's tank is a smaller model of his tank from the larger Captain America vs. Hydra set, so that is pretty cool.  It has those nice, olive green bricks and a little playability.  Captain America's tank is where it loses some people.  It just seems like a strange build.  Cap sits sideways in the round piece on top and it seems rather awkward.  Good thing his minifig kind of makes up for that.

Minifigs:  Some people have issues with their cartoonish faces and smaller legs, but I don't.  I think they did a great job with Captain America and gave him a rad throw-back look with white sleeves and of course he comes with his shield.  Red Skull's anguished face and simple print on his torso look good and he comes with the tesseract (sp?).  Unless you really dislike these mini-minifigs, I think they will make a nice addition to anyone's collection.

Well... I didn't really care for these at first, but ended up getting the entire set for myself and one for my son.  They look great on display and are super fun and easy to build.  That may be my favorite part actually- that my 5 year old can easily build these without my standing over him.  We both love them and are excited for the new wave to come out.

author: Renaissance_Ravensly
title: The Tank v.s The Jeep
review:
Hello Brickset readers. I figured I haven't given you a review in a while and I got this set for Easter, so I figured I'd review it for you.

 

Box/ Instructions

Nothing not to be expected here. The box shows the typical racing of the cars and the instructions are simple and really easy to follow.

Minifigures

The minifigures are cute and very comic in appearance. Some people hate them, but I like them. They make a sometimes welcomed departure from their awesome movie counterparts. Yuo get Capitan America and Red Skull in this set.

Build/ Parts

The build is very simple as you can get it done in a matter of minutes. The parts are not bad, but I feel they are very common, maybe some are in a new color. There are three stickers, which are not bad for a set like this, but I admit, I was driven crazy to precisely put them on.

Completed Model

The Completed Model looks nice, with a very comical looking tank and a Hydra Jeep. Even though they look comical, I like them a lot.

Overall

This is a nice set.It is very cheap, as it is only $10 in the U.S. I think the value is very good, as you get what you paid for. I recommend it in general and especially if you are on a tight budget. Hope to see you soon with another review

Ninja
